intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. wailauensis, commonly known as the Wailauensis bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This subspecies is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and slender, creeping stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
